result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney John M. O'Boyle in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

13CF250, 13CF251, 14CF5 & 14CF192

Plea entered previously in 14CF5 and all other cases previously dismissed.

C-31 discussed which was previously filed.  Court relates.
Restitution is not paid directly to the victim, but probation will disburse and will retain part of the money for their supervision fees.
$205.26 owing.
Court sets Review Hearing on 1- 27-2015 at 2:30 PM.  Balance of restitution to be paid by that time.  If paid, no appearance is necessary.
DOC to send notice prior to hearing.  

Court removes previous Order of 9 months jail banked.   To be deleted from JOC.

Clerk to send notice to Attorney Boyle and Defendant.  Review hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant John N Lulich in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Defendant John N Lulich in custody.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
13CF250, 13CF251, 14CF5 and 14CF192 called.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

13CF250 - DRI

13CF251
Count 1 - Dismiss
Count 2 & 3 - DRI

14CF5
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - Guilty plea
Count 3 - DRI

14CF192 - DRI

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  VIS filed.  State relates.  Attorney O'Boyle relates.  Court questions defendant about waiving PSI.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 2 years Probation
85 days jail - Credit for 85 days
Banking 9 months in the county jail to be used at discretion of Probation Agent upon Court approval
Restitution per C-31 - Bond money posted in 13CF250/251 and 14CF5 to be applied - Balance to be paid within the first 6 months of Probation
Court costs and DNA surcharge - tobe paid within 18 months of Probation
Must submit DNA sample
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent

Joint recommendation to apply bond money posted in 13CF250/251 and 14CF5 to the restitution.
